website_summaries.verdict: These professional knee pads feature foam-over-gel padding and a neoprene liner to allow for comfort, movement, and all-day work without slippage or pain.
pros: Great for people who put a lot of weight on the pads for extended periods of time
Neoprene makes these better than some others for work like roofing, because it helps minimize the slippage you get with a hard exterior plates
cons: Some reports of quality-control problems with some pairs – stitching, straps, gel feels like it wears out
Customer service and return policy murky

customer_reviews.title: Break in no time
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheaper pair of kneepads for a long time and when they finally wore out I wanted to try these "nicer" name brand pads. The first pair broke on the SECOND day of light use. Amazon was awesome and promptly sent me a pair for exchange which then ALSO broke just as fast in the exact same place! The knob that the strap connects to just pulls right out of the fabric, and I didn't even have them very tight, snug at best. I usually like Dewalt, but will not be buying their kneepads again. They are very comfy to kneel in though when the straps arent breaking. Not as comfy to walk in as some others.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last ... already broke!
customer_reviews.text: These pads could not withstand a diy project. I probably have about forty hours of use. Too bad. On to the next set, it won't be these! That's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: heperez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had these for 6 years and they were great. They were lost in a transition from one company to another. I'm probably going to order another pair. I'd like to see if I can get a free pair to show off to my co-workers (400+)! If not I'd still order them for myself. They are so comfortable even years later. Now that I don't have them crawling houses is miserable. Do yourself a favor and spend the few extra bucks for these. Your knees will thank you as you get older.v 6 stars out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Andress

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in the quality of these knee pads. In less than 1 month the piece that the strap clips onto had already ripped out of the knee pad so the top strap cannot be attached. Also the Velcro strap has frayed to where it will break almost any day now. Very disappointed in the quality of this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Big guy
customer_reviews.text: im a big guy over 300 lbs and work on my knees long hours and these are very comfortable the do make my knees sweat but it don't bother me cause they are very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: LHernandez

customer_reviews.title: Two Total Knee Replacements and These Are The Only Knee Pads I Will Ever Buy
customer_reviews.text: I had both knees totally replaced in 2009 & 2010 and thought I would never again be able to work while kneeling. Tried many types of knee pads before finding these. With these I can kneel for hours at a time without pain. They are comfortable, perfectly padded, and stable. The attachment system is well designed and keeps the pads in place where you put them. I have been using mine for over 4 years and they function as well as they did on day one. If they ever wear out I will buy another pair exactly like them.
customer_reviews.author: Rodd

customer_reviews.title: Like kneeling on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: I work in irrigation and bought these for when I'm replacing sprinkler heads, working over ditches, kneeling on roads, or curbs. These guys are like kneeling on a cloud. I'm trying to keep my knees in good shape and these make working so much more comfortable. I don't go to a jobsite without them. I can wear them for hours if need be. My only complaint is the lower Velcro strap. Overtime the stitching that holds the Velcro to the strap starts to separate, but the material is thin which makes it comfortable....I guess you cant have it both ways.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kramme

customer_reviews.title: Elastic stretches out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: At first I was excited to find a dewalt knee pad comparable to my old CLC pair. The dewalt knee pad started off well. I probably have about 80 hours worth of knee pad usage. It isn’t the most comfortable because it keeps sliding down which is readjusted by making the elastic velcro strap tighter. Unfortunately this isn’t the best to do because it cuts off circulation to my feet when leaning on my knees. The elastic has also given way and doesn’t stretch as it used to. The two thin velcro strips doesn’t hold on because the worn out elastic straps is stretched out. Was hoping more from Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn M

customer_reviews.title: A True Knee Saver
customer_reviews.text: I work as a field service technician so I'm always crawling around and working on my hands and knees and these knee pads are a knee saver. Personally, I don't wear the top strap as I need to quickly get my knee pads in and off, but the large Velcro strap does a very good job keeping these on my knees. The gel inserts truly helps to alleviate the abuse that a cement floor will do to your knees. I should warn though that there is a slight break in period and it took a day or two for my knees to get use to wearing these. Would recommend for any technician that spends considerably time on their knees.
customer_reviews.author: Wathan48

customer_reviews.title: Great material, poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these pads for work as plumber. After only 10-15 uses, the "slip buckle fastner" detached from the knee pad. Clasp is only attached to the top thin layer of fabric & not reinforced. I can no longer buckle top strap, so now pad is useless. Padding is extremely comfortable, but it is no use when you can't wear them any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Your knees will thank you for using these!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews I read did not do justice to these knee pads. I used them over 4 weekends rebuilding several large decks on days where it got quite hot. The gel padding was fantastic and kept my knees from getting wrecked. They are very comfortable, so much so that I forgot that I had them on at times. The price is great considering the comfort to your legs when working long hours and the quality that you get from the Dewalt brand. I have no doubt these will last me a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: First thing is you can never wear these around your friends. I was tiling and all anyone could talk about was how I did my best work on my knees. That being said, the tiling came our great and my knees were no worse for wear. I have not used a wide variety of kneepads, but these let me stay on my knees for hours without strain or pain. If you also do your best work on your knees, I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Thizzlehat

customer_reviews.title: Best knee protection for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love them! The reviews are accurate for this item. These get as comfortable for their design - yes, you need to adjust them properly, but they are not going to stay in place over several hours or hard work! And, yes, these can make your knee area sweaty, but I bought them to PROTECT my knees - not keep them cool. I'm 250# and I can drop to my knees on bare concrete without winching...several times...over and over again. I gave um 5 stars because they definitely will protect your knees. Price was cheaper than the local Home Depot / Lowes, which are typically the cheapest prices for Dewalt products here.
customer_reviews.author: f8ldzz

customer_reviews.title: Worth it :D
customer_reviews.text: At my job, I'm continually alternating between being on my feet and crawling around on my hands & knees. These knee pads have a tendency to want to slide down, so I have to re-position them fairly often. But, that's not unusual with these style knee pads. For the comfort that they provide for my knees, I don't mind having to slide them back up every now and then. That's still infinitely better than the knee pain that you get when you're always crawling around with no knee pads at all. Worth it :D
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L.

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt DG5204 KneePads are my answer for Roofing
customer_reviews.text: Other knee pads have a 'Hard Shelled' outer/exposed surface. This might be okay for Concrete work of Flooring work, but TERRIBLE for Roofing. This model of Dewalt Pads has the answer: Neoprene on the Fronts. This keeps your knees from slipping on Roofing Jobs. It's the ONLY ONE I could find that is built this way.
customer_reviews.author: Artmon

customer_reviews.title: Have Been GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I bought these since I'm ripping up carpet and laying down a new floor in 5 rooms. I'm 1/2 way through and LOVE these DEWALT DG5204 Professional Kneepads with Layered Gel and Neoprene Fabric Liner so much! I highly recommend. Some of the tools I bought haven't lasted as long but these have been a LIFESAVER! I tried to start without these and quickly stopped. They have been great with long pants and shorts.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Knee pads fail pre maturely.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big Dewalt fan but unfortunately I am writing this review because I purchased these knee pads and don’t want someone else to be disappointed. I have use these knee pads on 3 different job sites and the current one I am on now the button ripped of where the strap clips to and now they are useless. Please see picture. First picture shows the button being ripped off and second picture you can see the thread separating.
customer_reviews.author: LiL Blue

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Executed
customer_reviews.text: These DeWalt knee pads work perfectly for my needs. The wearing surface is durable, non-marring and easy to clean. The interior cushioning is soft enough to absorb the impact of kneeling quickly on concrete, but firm enough to be stable when working and moving about on your knees. The retention straps are well designed and hold the knee pads in place even when walking. They do get a little warm on hot days, and I prefer to wear them over jeans rather than with shorts. For working on hard abrasive surfaces, like concrete or asphalt, these knee pads are a major improvement over kneeling pads, gardening knee pads and lesser construction knee pads.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Spittle III

customer_reviews.title: ... pads I'm used to but the gel insert is super comfortable! I think these are going to be ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a little larger than the normal low-cost knee pads I'm used to but the gel insert is super comfortable! I think these are going to be my new favorite job site items! I wear knee pads for pretty much 8 hours a day when I'm on a job. These guys are the first time I've decided to spend a little more than usual and I have not been disappointed. They cover a larger area of my leg but that isn't a problem for me. I really love the gel insert.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Roberts

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: do you do tile? flooring? anything on your knees and you're over, say, thirty years old? Dewalt is a little more expensive, but I've never regretted going with quality when it comes to tools... and these are no different. Don't hesitate; buy these if you spend time on your knees. ... wonder if I can convince my wife to try them?
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shumake

customer_reviews.title: Knee Surgery
customer_reviews.text: These knee pads are heavy and make my knees sweat but after knee surgery they are the only ones I tried that let me get down on my knees on the concrete floor at work again. I tried five different brands, I returned four and kept these. I give them 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, I need a second pair.
customer_reviews.text: These pads are one of the best purchases I have made in quite a while. Being older, and with some injuries, I was afraid to kneel down in fear of pain or that I wouldn't be able to get up. With these pads I kneel down all of the time for various chores, knowing that I will feel comfortable, and the confidence that I will be able to stand up on my own, with out too much struggle. Great gel cushion cover my knees completely, with a rubber tread on the outside which are well built enough for laying brick, or soft enough to to scratch laminate flooring.
customer_reviews.author: MikeAVacaville

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pads.
customer_reviews.text: They're kneepads...when I have to use them, I'm not typically in the most enjoyable situation in the world. But, they make it as pleasant as possible! I figured I should probably take care of my knees (and my hearing, too, as many construction workers neglect...in fact, I'd venture to say the large majority. Pick yourself up someear protection for that - this kind is always there when you need it. I think convenience is the biggest reason for lack of usage.), because I don't want to have bad knees when I'm older. I figured these'd help! Time will tell, but I truly believe they will improve my quality of life at an older age. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: E. B. Davison

customer_reviews.title: Tend to slip around
customer_reviews.text: These knee pads tend to slip around even when tightened as tight as I can get them. They are a bit bulky too. They do provide maximum protection on extremely rough surfaces, however, I think there are better products out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Slides of your knee even when very tight
customer_reviews.text: This knee pad may be satisfactory when working on level floors, but on uneven surfaces, the pads slide off your knee even when the straps are very tight, which exposes your knee to damage. Also, one of the posts for the top strap came off and was lost. These knee pads are unacceptable for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Straps broke first day
customer_reviews.text: YES BUY THEM: You are on your knee's for a few hours of the day. General construction use. DO NOT BUY THIS: If you are on your knee's for more than 3-4 hours of the day. They are comfortable, but do not feel good due to the hard plastic on the outside ( Yellow) makes maneuvering over longer periods painful. I have been doing flooring, the top straps blow out after first day. They are still usable, and even more comfortable without them.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Maier

customer_reviews.title: Great protection, but not for those with small knees.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tile setter, so I'm on my knees all day. These do a really fantastic job of protecting a person's knees, but they're designed for larger knees than mine. I'm female, 5'3", I wear 32-30 pants. Any time I got up from the floor, these would slide right off my knees; I'd have to pull them up and readjust my pant legs every time. I ended up giving them to a larger friend and buying a different set of knee pads. If you're small, these are not your knee pads.
customer_reviews.author: AMN

customer_reviews.title: Great pads, Great deal !
customer_reviews.text: Got on Prime Day at 50 % of normal cost in Lowes or Home Depot, so grabbed them. Super high quality, I'm a big guy and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: doug m

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. One tile job, about 6 hours of use and the stitching is ripping from the velcro wrap around, plus a grommet pulled out from where the slide over buckle hooks. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these last year after reading all of the good reviews. They are very comfortable but after no more than 6 uses one of the parts has come apart thus making them worthless. I expected better quality for the price - the ones I have from Harbour Freight have outlasted these x10
customer_reviews.author: flatfox

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Super soft and cushy. but uncomfortable when worn all day. Mostly due to back of knee bunch-up. And my biggest problem with them was they roll over when you move laterally on your knees If your not using them for extended periods of time and not shifting around much these might work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These worked fine for me (a petite woman) and my husband (a very tall man). Without pads, I cannot put weight on my right knee without it hurting, with these pads I was able to crawl around while installing hard floors and I didn't feel any pain at all. They are much better than the type of knee pads you would use for gardening. I preferred wearing them over jeans. When I wore them with shorts, the straps rubbed the skin on the backs of my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Christy in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 hrs
customer_reviews.text: Used these to tape off base in hallways, had them on for about 5 hours and the button came out of the knee pad, making it useless. Im not that heavy 234 pounds, should be able to get at least a full day out of them before they break.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Droge

customer_reviews.title: Solid, good, but a small manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: They work fine, and save my knees a bunch of punishemrbt. they slip down very gradually, but i have never found knee pads that dont. Confortable for all day use, or walking around. My one problem is that the grommet post on the left knee pad is started coming loose day two of use. It seems like there is a defect in the fabric around it. I fixed it temprarily, but it will definitely fail before the right side. When it does, Ill have to figure out a way to reaffix it. That said, it is hanging on, a couple months later.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gawne

customer_reviews.title: Priceless
customer_reviews.text: NOW THESE ARE JUST WONDERFUL! My guy is a mason by trade so he is always near mortar/cement and stuff that gets hard real quick. I thought that this was going to be hard to clean but not at all! I thought these would not be hold up for the terrain but not at all. These things can go the distance and then some! Can't put a price on your health and I am glad I got these for him....idk what took me so long to get them!
customer_reviews.author: YWChula

customer_reviews.title: Female likes theses for washing the floor.
customer_reviews.text: The older I get, the worse my knees are. I bought these to use when I get on my knees to wash my kitchen floor. Tried them out today. They are very cushiony on the old bones but will take some time to get use to. I felt taller than normal and a little wobbly using them. They will work good once I am more comfortable with them and save what is left of the knees
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not even true dewalt brand. Made by another company (CLC)and dewalt put their name on it. Horrible construction. One of the snaps broke on first day. Got replacement and it will be broke soon too, just bad engineering. They are comfortable tho before they break
customer_reviews.author: rhyno

customer_reviews.title: They were great at first but wore down very swiftly
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my hubby who was insisting upon destroying his knees on his very taxing handyman job. His previous set of "gel" kneepads from OSH didn't last very long. They were great at first but wore down very swiftly. THESE, however, have been holding up! He doesn't rant and rave about these sorts of things but every few months I ask "How're the kneepads holding up" and he'll chipperly reply, "they're great!" Good enough for me! I've also caught sight of them and they look in perfect shape. Sometimes he even comes home wearing them! I take that as a sign that they must be comfy, too. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best “tool” I own
customer_reviews.text: I use these for large home renovation projects and they are my favorite “tool” in my tool box. Have had them on multiple construction mission trips and they have saved my knees! After a lot of use the elastic starts to stretch a bit and they do make your knees a little sweaty, but that’s a small price to pay for the perfect comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Pain Free Knees using these!
customer_reviews.text: I am a large person that needed knee pads for cleaning my tile floors (nothing beats scrubbing by hand on tile floors!) and general housework cleaning baseboards, etc. I also have arthritis on one knee and had used a less expensive brand in the past with poor results. I have to say these pads are remarkable! The fit is very comfortable with the soft elastic straps and big enough to cushion the sides of my knees too. I was able to spend a couple hours using them with absolutely no discomfort while doing so and no pain in the knee the next day either. Once again I've learned you get what you pay for and these are worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Lasts for years.
customer_reviews.text: These are very good knee pads. I've had several pairs over the years. However, the last 2 pairs have had an extra gel cushion which tends to cause a roll. Kind of like a loose saddle on a horse. Quickly remedied however by a small incision on the inside bottom to pull the thing out. Doesn't hurt a bit. .
customer_reviews.author: richard breshears

customer_reviews.title: Maybe great for a really big person. Too big for me.
customer_reviews.text: These are massive and awkward to wear. If you’re a huge guy and need giant knee pads, these are for you. I’m a medium sized woman, and these are just weird on me. The outside hard shell is massive and makes kneeling awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Best pair I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I order these for my stepdad every time his break. He's 63 and has been a painter since 86'. He's gone through many pads over the years and asked if there was a way to order new ones online. We found these and he absolutely loves them! He says they don't pinch like a lot of kneepads he's worn, the price is right, very comfortable for 'old bones'. We've bought three sets already and I use the worn out ones (still have enough padding for younger guys) for my DIY projects in the shed. 10/10 seal of approval.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are amazing. Completely surround your knee in comfort
customer_reviews.text: These thing are the b@lls. They are amazing. Completely surround your knee in comfort. Things that usually hurt are nothing to deal with now. My midwestern male ethos feels guilty using them because it seems like there should be SOME discomfort. But no - just gel goodness and happiness around your knees. Before they were delivered I was prepared to feel like I overspent (and thus feel foolish) but once I strapped these bad boys on I was only 100% happy I had made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Viehland

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: The buttons have a major manufacturer defect. They didn’t install a rivet around the button and after light use the bottom will come out. CLC and Dewalt should be ashamed to put their names on these knee pads.
customer_reviews.author: Guadz

customer_reviews.title: but they really are great. They're comfortable and they feel like serious protection
customer_reviews.text: Loving these knee pads so far. I work in a construction environment (painting and finishing) about 10 hours a day and am often kneeling at work. Anybody who has to do this kind of work every day knows what it does to your knees. I was skeptical about spending the money on these, but they really are great. They're comfortable and they feel like serious protection. Love the hard shell with rubber grips on the front so they don't slide around on the floor while you're kneeling. The gel padding on the inside feels great! I've recommended them to several coworkers. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Hewett

customer_reviews.title: These looked great, sounded great
customer_reviews.text: These looked great, sounded great, and were going to save my husband's knees when he installed flooring. Nope. Within a few hours the first time he wore them, they were already ripping. Unfortunately, my husband told me about it after the return period was closed. Save your money. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mama to Four

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST perfect..
customer_reviews.text: ALMOST perfect ..... I work for an Airline and I'm always on my knees I usually only use the bottom strap but on this case the knee pad would go lower leaving my knee expose ..... I have to constantly pull it to the right position .... Maybe cause I wear cargo pants .... Will try it again soon with shorts ..... But over all this are excellent knee pads
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn these several times since I’ve bought them and the padding is super comfortable. The front grip doesn’t let you slide it has great traction. The Velcro and clip keep it in place fairly well. I’m a large man and I feel that these support me very well. Great quality construction
customer_reviews.author: Samuel A.  Perez

customer_reviews.title: If only i would have had these years ago
customer_reviews.text: I work construction and am constantly having to kneel when working. My knees had been giving me problems for some time, so I read the reviews on these and ordered. I am glad I did. They fit a little snug but you get used to it. They have a non slip rubber pad that comes in handy when working on concrete and tile. The hard outer shell saves your knees from screws and rocks. The gel padding is what makes it for me. They are very comfortable. It tool about a month, but my knees rarely ever give me problems anymore. I wish I would have a pair of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: conerned

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses these for every house hold project he has
customer_reviews.author: Starla Perry

customer_reviews.title: I have had 3 sets of these
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 sets of these. All have same issues. The upper strap clips to a button. The button easily snags & pulls out of materials. Also, the pads slide down off knee & down leg while walking. These should have a single wide strap to go behind knee.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Moon

customer_reviews.title: What your knees need
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my husband because he had the same kind for years but they had fallen apart and he was so grateful coming home from work. They feel like you’re kneeling on a cloud. The only thing he noticed is the Dewalt name faded after a couple weeks, and his old ones still had the name intact even though the rest of them were falling apart. Idk what that’s about but it’s not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: Julie Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great knee pads
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great knee pads. They fit comfortably and stay where I want them when properly placed on my knees. They provide a really good balance between solid protection against the floor and soft cushioning for my knees. This is a high quality item.
customer_reviews.author: justme

customer_reviews.title: They fall down your leg
customer_reviews.text: cushion is almost to thick and padded. They require constant adjustment as they fall down your leg when you stand up. The straps will loose elasticity over time. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: volvotech

customer_reviews.title: DG5204 Kneepads - Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have never used knee pads before. These are great. I use them to work on my cars when I have to get down on the concrete floor. They feel strange when I wear them just walking around the garage, but that is probably because I have never wore any before. I can not belief how I have absolutely no pain to my knees while using these. I weigh about 275 lbs and the jell or whatever is inside these knee pads are great. I would recommend the Dewalt DG5204 Professional Kneepads to anyone having to do any work on their knees.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hudgens

customer_reviews.title: Great Scott these are some incredible knee pads!
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm taking on a first time home improvement project; installing tile floor through most of my home. I'm no spring chicken and have certainly been in better shape at other points in time. With that being said, I'm going after this effort with the youthful vigor of a 40+-year-old dude that's never installed tile before. After finishing one room here's what I can say about installing tile: My hands are bleeding I think I have miner's lung My back is obliterated But...my knees are friggin perfect, thanks Dewalt!
customer_reviews.author: iluvmybeamer

customer_reviews.title: Soft but poorly made straps
customer_reviews.text: My straps tore in less than 6 months. I probably use these 60 days out of the year. Very comfortable on the knees, a little tight behind the knee, when the strap was not broken
customer_reviews.author: Eckhard G. Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Great pads for the first week.
customer_reviews.text: I used these everyday for two weeks before they fell apart. There is a design flaw around the buttons that you use to snap the top strap into the place. The material they used unraveled on both knee pads before the buttons just fell out due to the holes being far to large. The pads themselves are fantastic and if it wasn't for this major design flaw they would be perfect for me. I can't see this being a one time thing as the material they used didn't have any stitching or reinforcement around the buttons so I can only imagine this will happen to anyone using these knee pads more then a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Gel makes the difference! Love these.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for my husband and his brother who install carpet, linoleum and hardwood flooring on a regular basis. Purchased 2 years ago and it was time for new sets. The Gel held up very well over 2 years but the velcro needed to be cleaned out every so often due to carpet fibers building up on them. Not bulky or too heavy. Husband loves his new pair and brother in-law still doesn't want to part with his old ones;he likes them that much.
customer_reviews.author: leothelion

customer_reviews.title: purchased as a gift for my diy dad - he ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased as a gift for my diy dad - he is always tiling, laying wood floor, etc and as he's getting older, i wanted him to protect his knees from all the wear and tear! purchased these because the brand is reputable and so far they seem to be working well for my dad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these knee pads...
customer_reviews.text: These knee pads are awesome. I have been using a cheaper pair for the last couple of years, and they get the job done. The last 6 months I have been using knee pads a lot, so I decided to take it up a notch, and I am glad I did. These are real comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: shane lewis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable pads, but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable on the knees, but the rivet on the top side loop and hook closure came loose cloth material holding on about the 4th use. Maybe a velcro on both top and bottom would be a more useful design or embed the rivet in a hard material rather than just cloth.
customer_reviews.author: M S Gill

customer_reviews.title: Stitching is weak
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro straps are strong, but the stitching is not. When removing the knee straps from the Velcro, the Velcro comes loose. The Velcro needs additional stitching reinforcement. I had to fix by sewing the knee straps. No true DeWalt quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Luckily the bottom strap is much thicker and can handle holding the knee pads in place pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: These knee pads work well, and definitely protect well, but with first 40 minutes of use the rivet on the top strap gave out on one, and then shortly after the other rivet popped out too. The rivets are attached to fabric, and having hooking them in, and leaving them as much slack as possible in them, the rivets popped out of the fabric. Luckily the bottom strap is much thicker and can handle holding the knee pads in place pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Padding is good, I they just won't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Padding is good, I they just won't stay in place. I used them for Spelunking in caves a few months ago, had to constantly readjust. Probably not their intended use, may have also been my pants under them were too loose. So, this may not be a useful review, since it might have been me and not the pads. But, if you're crawling in caves with loose blue jeans, I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Archaeology Student Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a couple of years ago for my first archaeology field school to Virginia. I'm an older student (I was 37 at the time) and I needed something that would support my old knees while digging. I've even used these at the house while planting flowers and they have kept my knees stable. I did cut the top "buckle" off of them because it was pinching my leg, but other than that they have been great! I am going to Belize this month which will be ultimate test!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P

customer_reviews.title: Would not recoomend
customer_reviews.text: The straps are way too big and barely catch any velcro when strapped. They are constantly sliding up and down and really make your knees ache after a day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and helpful
customer_reviews.text: As an electrician I am stuck in awkward positions for long periods of time and when you need to get a head sometimes its on your knees! Get it a "head" on your knees. Anyways your going
customer_reviews.author: Robert Floreza Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The gel is comfortablebut they slide around alot expected better from dewalt need for tile jump has cheaper kneepads ...
customer_reviews.text: The gel is comfortablebut they slide around alot expected better from dewalt need for tile jump has cheaper kneepads that never slide around kneee area also they are very heavy so weighs down your jeans so hour pants drop to your knees im like $180 5'7... I would never buy again wish i could return but used them...
customer_reviews.author: Ra Large

customer_reviews.title: happy tile floor installer
customer_reviews.text: at first I wasn't wild about em...got used to the old pair I had for 10-15 yrs...now after 3 months or so...they're great...comfortable...protective to knees that have had too many operations already
customer_reviews.author: AutieK

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design From a Company From Which You Expect Better
customer_reviews.text: These knee pads have plenty of padding and they're certainly comfortable to knee in. But with any knee pad that is flat, like these, instead of contoured to fit a knee you can expect to have to constantly pull them up off your shins every time you stand up from kneeling.
customer_reviews.author: greatpenguini

customer_reviews.title: DG5204 PROFESSONAL KNEEPADS WITH LAYERED GEK AND NEOPRENE FABRIC FAIL
customer_reviews.text: I'm a DIY and own many Dewalt's hand and power tools that I like use often but they totally failed on the knee pads. Bought them in August 2019 and in April 2020 the metal button that holds the upper strap on pulled out of the fabric. Very Disappointing. like the other reviews I could not contact Dewalt by phone or email so I'm using the Amazon review to report the issue. DeWalt's web site is useless as far as contacting them.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable with or without pants
customer_reviews.text: After several knee pads that never quite fit I found these. I am a carpenter and sometimes work on my knees all day. With these pads my knees are never sore or uncomfortable. There are no spots that pinch my legs or knees, they are comfortable with or without pants. The wide bottom strap helps keep these up although of course some adjustment is needed periodically. The fact that they stay in place is really big for me because all other pairs needed to be pulled up constantly. After several months they are still in good shape and seem well made. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harness

customer_reviews.title: I can crawl again...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for knee pads on the advice of a friend who had knee replacements. I also had both knees replaced and bought these. I love them. After having both knees replaced, getting on all fours felt...weird. With these pads, I feel nothing. They are very plush and attach easily and securely. If you are looking for an excellent pair of knee pads, these are it!
customer_reviews.author: Steve C.

customer_reviews.title: What the doctor ordered
customer_reviews.text: Quality kneepads. I'm not a tradesman, but I do lots of weekend warrior work, plus I'm old enough to get aches and pains (new hip this month). These are quite good, and very comfortable. Negatives? The hard surface is a little slippery in some instances (on plastic sheathing, new tile), but that may improve with a little break-in/roughing up. Still getting used to straps, and some drop down - but I've had that on all kneepads. Very good overall. Bought these after getting recommendations from tradesmen plumber and stone mason. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Victor R.

customer_reviews.title: No great shakes
customer_reviews.text: As is the case with most knee pads, they do not form to the knee allowing it to move around inside the pad. Fastening system is common as well. Nothing special so they are uncomfortable. Best pads ever were the old Patella Bead knee pads. They wrapped around the knee. Never slipping. Always comfortable. Like a piece of your body.
customer_reviews.author: capnjohn

customer_reviews.title: Great on the knees
customer_reviews.text: Great on the knees, wonderful price , fast shipping, but after 2 days wearing them the velcro is pulling away from the fabric and making holes. I will be contacting them to exchange/return them.
customer_reviews.author: Princessmp79

customer_reviews.title: The first day they were perfectly comfortable and I thought great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these kneepads because I am laying pavers and I am on my knees all day. The first day they were perfectly comfortable and I thought great, but by the end of the day the padding inside actually dissipated and left only the hard cover for protection. On the second day I had to quit using the pads because they no longer cushioned my knees and it was actually painful. Now, I don't know if the pads cushioning was faulty and just a problem with only this pair or a design flaw effecting all pads.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great kneepads
customer_reviews.text: At best, I'm an "once-a-month handyman" around the house. These kneepads work as advertised, and I would buy them again. Now, since Amazon can't seem to get a handle on the fake reviews, I'll add my own: Super! ... Great item ... Buy for your Mom ... Clearly superior quality ... Keep one in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Knee Pads
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently remodeling my house by putting in hardwood flooring and tile in our great room and one of our bathrooms so I decided to get some knee pads to help minimize the aches and pains. These knee pads are perfect for the job! They are both comfortable and durable. They are basically like having comfortable shoes for your knees. I highly recommend these knee pads to anyone who is doing any type of work where they are having to crawl around a lot because I believe it will prevent many injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bailey

customer_reviews.title: but I love them. After my aging knees suffered too many ...
customer_reviews.text: These are probably an overkill for my need (working in the yard), but I love them. After my aging knees suffered too many cheap alternatives over the years, they're thanking me for splurging and buying these comfortable kneepads.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Rich

customer_reviews.title: He loved them! He has had 3 knee surgeries and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a Christmas gift, but my son and I decided to give early as there was a home project that my husband would be working on and would need these. WOW! He loved them! He has had 3 knee surgeries and he said these were great. He is 6'2, large build. The adjustable straps were perfect to keep in place and make him comfortable as he worked. I should have bought these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dara

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and will last for years. I removed the hard outer shell on the last pair I bought and they still lasted 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: david glatting

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could rate these higher than five stars
customer_reviews.text: While I'm a huge fan of dying on my feet rather than on my knees, for those of you that feel differently, these are the knee pads for you. Easy to don, super comfortable, tough, buy a set for the handy man in your life. Either way, these will be used gratefully when the time is right. Seriously, I have no cartilage left in my knees, so these are essential tools every time I have to get down on the floor to do some work.
customer_reviews.author: Kevn Alford

customer_reviews.title: These are the best knee pads I've used.
customer_reviews.text: After recently holding a job in an inventory sorting and receiving company I was constantly on my knees forced to use the tough gear branded pads. These are more than twice as comfortable and less than half the price! I can't believe how soft the gel is in these compared to the one's from the warehouse. Had these been my daily driver, would probable been happier at work.
customer_reviews.author: Polyboy03g

customer_reviews.title: These are the real thing. If you spend a ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the real thing. If you spend a lot of time crawling around on the floor or on the ground these will be a blessing. I have two artificial knees and trying to kneel can be agony but these knee pads make it possible. Well built. Worth every penney.
customer_reviews.author: Warren W. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, but overall I’ve been disappointed. The Velcro straps aren’t very strong so they often come undone. Also the pads tend to slide down my legs when I walk so I have to pull them back up. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because they’re fairly thick and comfortable, so it’s not a total loss. Still, I had hoped for more.
customer_reviews.author: jamonit

customer_reviews.title: the elastic being the area that experienced the most wear but I use them every time I do a job and they work great. As a small b
customer_reviews.text: These kneepads have lasted me for years. They are way beat up now, the elastic being the area that experienced the most wear but I use them every time I do a job and they work great. As a small business owner I've made these kneepads required equipment for all of our laborers - feels like they can really save your body after 20-30 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L Miller

customer_reviews.title: the best knee pads .
customer_reviews.text: best knee pads I ever owned, and ive tried plenty from the cheap home depot special to what I thought was real knee pads but were so un comfortable on the back of my knees n legs that couldn't wear them. these r so comfy I forget I'm wearing them until I kneel down and feel that incredible cushion instead of pain. seriously considering a second pair .
customer_reviews.author: L.I.Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knee pad
customer_reviews.text: My knee always hurt when I have to be on my knees workout on some home project. Thats why i got these knee pads. It saves my knee from pain the next day. When I work on my car, not sure why i always wear shorts, and it jacks up my knees without protection. These knee pads are a miracle.
customer_reviews.author: henry

customer_reviews.title: The Best !
customer_reviews.text: The best knee pads by far. Usually I only get about 2 weeks from even the best pair at $50.00 a pop. These give me at least 6 months or more. I have tried air, gel, foam, knee pads that look like goalie shin guards, and the best ones I have found are on someone eles's knees.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cushioning power!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 pair of these: one for myself, a pair for my husband once he started using mine, and another to give as a gift for the uncle who has everything. If you spend any time working in the yard, on cars, or anything like that, these are fantastic knee-savers.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Good

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a friend and this is the second set I bought. He uses them at work and is very happy with how long they last and how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought them sooner!!
customer_reviews.text: These knee pads are outstanding! They provide the best cushion I have ever had for my knees. I am a DIYer and injured my knee while crawling around with my old cheap knee pads on! A little late in getting these. If I would have know about the Dewalt pads before or done more research I would not have a bad knee know. Believe me that the little extra $ is a lot better than surgery!
customer_reviews.author: GaryHF

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for these kneepads but was disappointed. Yes they have soft padding that feels comfortable. The problem is the hard shell outside. Once you put on these kneepads your knees tend to roll off the hard outside like if you were balancing on a ball with your knee. Maybe after a period of use the plastic will flatten somewhat so it doesn't tend to roll. Also, the lower straps could have been longer.
customer_reviews.author: J Doherty

customer_reviews.title: When you knees are as bad as mine
customer_reviews.text: Its been a while since I purchased these but they are getting a lot of use. When you knees are as bad as mine, you need good protection. These are the best kneepads I've had. Comfortable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Only good if you don't move
customer_reviews.text: Never stays in place. I have used these several times and as long as you don't move around they are fine. But, if you are crawling around on your knees they slide down off your knees and end up on your shins.
customer_reviews.author: keefer

customer_reviews.text: Best knee pads I’ve ever owned. I wish they had made a multi-cam version when I served in the army. I would have ALWAYS worn these. Super comfortable and not constricting
customer_reviews.author: MDJJ

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, can't keep them on my knees as ...
customer_reviews.text: Bad design, can't keep them on my knees as they tend to slide off to the side no matter how tight the straps are.
customer_reviews.author: Eric102

product_meta.title: DEWALT DG5204 Professional Kneepads with Layered Gel and Neoprene Fabric Liner
product_meta.description:
Professional kneepads with layered gel, non-skid, heavy-duty cap designed for added stability & wear, layered gel technology over thick, closed cell foam padding surrounds knee for the ultimate in support & comfort, slip buckle fastener system with adjustable straps, large, adjustable neoprene strap for comfort & stability, convenient upper tab for easy repositioning on knee, Ballistic poly material provides strength & durability, neoprene fabric liner helps keep knees comfortable throughout the day.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From 1924 to 2016 DEWALT continues to design and optimize professional workhorse solutions- tools, accessories and service - to ensure absolute confidence for the toughest jobsite conditions. WE are DEWALT, and we are GUARANTEED TOUGH.
feature_bullets: DURABLE KNEEPADS: Ballistic poly material provides long lasting strength on this professional heavy duty kneepads.
EASY REPOSITIONING: These durable kneepads feature an upper tab for easy respositioning on the knee, slip-buckle fastener system with adjustable straps, large, adjustable neoprene straps.
GEL TECHNOLOGY: Layered over thick, close-cell foam padding surrounds knees for ultimate support and comfort in these professional kneepads.
NON-SKID KNEEPADS: Heavy duty caps on these kneepads are designed for stability and wear.
MULTI-SURFACE: These durable kneepads are designed for cement, brick, and all flooring surfaces.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,475 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
